name: MDLStereoscopicCamera
desc: A point of view for rendering a stereoscopic display of a 3D scene.

items.name: var interPupillaryDistance: Float
items.desc: The distance, in millimeters, between the stereoscopic camera’s two viewpoints.

items.name: var overlap: Float
items.desc: The amount, as a fraction of image width, by which the images from the camera’s two viewpoints overlap.

items.name: var leftVergence: Float
items.desc: The angle, in degrees, at which the camera’s left viewpoint faces toward a central focal point.

items.name: var rightVergence: Float
items.desc: The angle, in degrees, at which the camera’s right viewpoint faces toward a central focal point.

items.name: var leftViewMatrix: matrix_float4x4
items.desc: The transformation matrix that determines the position and orientation of the camera’s left viewpoint relative to a scene.

items.name: var leftProjectionMatrix: matrix_float4x4
items.desc: The transformation matrix that determines the extent of a scene visible to the camera’s left viewpoint.

items.name: var rightViewMatrix: matrix_float4x4
items.desc: The transformation matrix that determines the position and orientation of the camera’s right viewpoint relative to a scene.

items.name: var rightProjectionMatrix: matrix_float4x4
items.desc: The transformation matrix that determines the extent of a scene visible to the camera’s right viewpoint.
